node.title: Respecting Food
node.label: 11. September 2020
node.introduction: Have you ever thought about the meals you eat and given them a respect ranking? What does this even mean?

node.title: Top Tips for Picky Eaters
node.label: 10. September 2020
node.introduction: Some people just don't like a lot of food or let's just say, they like what they like and that's all there is to it!

node.introduction: Have you heard of Mindful Eating?

node.title: Mexican Salsa
node.introduction: This salad uses all the ingredients for a classic tomato salsa and guacamole but with the addition of sweetcorn and black beans. The lime juice and chilli add zing and heat, perfect served with any Mexican style dishes.

node.title: Kachumba Salad
node.introduction: Kachumber is a quick and easy salad that can be served as a side to many Indian dishes. It adds crunch, flavor and texture to foods and works well with hot and spicy dishes. As well as having the added benefit of increasing your daily vegetable intake the ingredients offer a wealth of vitamins and minerals. It keeps well in the fridge for 2-3 days and is also perfect for take along lunches or picnics.

node.title: Greek Salad
node.introduction: Who doesn't love a Greek salad? This makes a great addition to any meal, picnic or BBQ. The protein from the feta and the healthy fats from the olive oil and olives bring balance making it a light but filling standalone meal too.

node.text:
Who said you can't have your cake and eat it? Well maybe not the whole thing but definitely a slice!
It's really important to eat in a balanced way. That means nothing is off limits, everything is allowed and every mouthful is thoroughly enjoyed!
It also means that I'm mindful of the meals before and after, ensuring that they are as nutrient dense and as functional as possible. This Spiced Fig & Walnut cake was to celebrate my father in-law turning 79 and it was absolutely the biz!!! 😋
#foodasmedicine #functionalfoods #cakeboss #celebrations #glutenfreecake #keepingitreal #happybirthday #rebalancingyou #walnutandfigcake #seasonalfood #eatcakebehappy

Recipe testing today! Sweet Potato & Peanut Butter Brownie Bites.

I'm always on a mission to increase the nutrient content of my food especially in baked goods. An easy way to do this is by using fruits and vegetables in the recipe. Whenever I recipe test I always make a scaled down version, this helps to avoid waste if it doesn't work out. Luckily you can't really go wrong with chocolate so there was no danger of that happening today!

Another great way of increasing nutrient content and giving function to food is by swapping out processed flours and using ground nuts instead which add protein and healthy fats. This means that they will help to keep blood sugar levels even, help with energy and keep you fuller for longer. 
Today I used sweet potato but you could quite easily use beetroot, pumpkin or butternut squash. The sweet potatoes add a wonderful texture and because they are sweet it means that only a little maple syrup is needed to get the taste just right. 

I ate two bites with a cup of tea, just to test them of course! 😎

If you'd like the recipe sign up to my Rebalancing You Community it's going to be in the Autumn Edit. Link in bio 

#eatyourgreens #eatmoreplants #eatarainbow🌈 #eatarainboweveryday #guthealth #guthealthmatters #feedthegut #rebalancingyou 
#healthybalance #goodguthealth #healthybakedgoods #brownieblissbites #brownierecipe #glutendairyfreebrownies #fabulousbaking #recipetesting #addvegtoyourbaking #sweetpotatopenutbutterbrownies #peanutbutterlover

You know when something is so good there literally are no words to describe it!! Well this  is one of those times!! I think it's down to the tahini milk! Which is amazing!! It's only 3 ingredients and it's so easy to make.

Tahini Milk
125ml cold water
1tbsp tahini 
1tsp raw honey 
* Whizz it up in a blender and it's done! Add an ice cube or two to get it extra chilled. 

I poured it over some oats and let it sit for 5 minutes or so, whilst it was soaking I added around 100g frozen blueberries to a pan and  simmered until they burst (cooking blueberries like this gives them a spike in nutrients - increasing their antioxidant and polyphenol content significantly) I then chopped up some fresh figs and scattered them over with a few pistachios. Pure bliss! 

#sundaybreakfastvibes #tahinimilk #makeyourownmilk #antioxidant #polyphenols #guthealth #guthealthmatters #rebalancingyou #rebalancingyoucommunity #breakfastideas #ilovetahini #weekendbreakfast #nowordsneeded #goodmoodfoods #glutenfreebreakfastidea #veganfoodheaven #veganbreakfastideas #plantpower #plantbasedbreakfastideas #dairyfreebreakfastideas

metadata.siteDescription: ENERGISE, RESTORE, NOURISH. I'm studying with the renowned Institute for Optimum Nutrition and will qualify next year. Until then, this is a place to inspire and share healthful information, tips, tricks and recipes. I hope to energise, restore and nourish your body mind and soul!
